title: Bug 18028: Rename package doesn't check if all resources are writeable
description: When attempting to rename a package in the software, the system does not verify if all the resources within the package are writeable. As a result, unexpected exception dialogs appear after the renaming process is completed.
OB:
To reproduce this bug:
1. Create a package with a source code file in it.
2. Make the source code file read-only.
3. Try to rename the package.

Observe: After the renaming process finishes, an unexpected exception dialog is displayed.
EB: The system should perform a check to ensure that all resources within a package are writeable before allowing the package to be renamed. If any resource is read-only, the rename operation should be blocked and appropriate error messages should be displayed to the user.
SR:
1. Implement a verification process before allowing package renaming, checking if all resources in the package are writeable.
2. If any resource is found to be read-only, block the rename operation.
3. Display appropriate error messages to inform the user of the failed rename operation and the reason (readonly resource).
